00076 int store_pci_map( vector<PciDevice>& pci_map_list, OsInfo& osInfo )
00077 {
00078   std::string uniqueKernelId_;  // Unique ID representing an OS.
00079   std::string mod_name_id;      // ID representing a Module name.
00080 
00081   // Get the unique ID for the given OS.
00082   uniqueKernelId_=queryOsKernelId(osInfo.getDistro(),osInfo.getRelease(),osInfo.getKernel(),osInfo.getArch());
00083 
00084   
00085   if( uniqueKernelId_ == "" )                   // If the OS doesn't exist in database.
00086     uniqueKernelId_ = recordOsInfo(osInfo);     // Store the OS in database, and get it's unique ID.
00087 
00088   
00089   // Iterate through the pcimap list.
00090   vector<PciDevice>::iterator vec_iter;
00091   for ( vec_iter = pci_map_list.begin(); vec_iter != pci_map_list.end(); ++vec_iter ){
00092 
00093     mod_name_id = checkModuleNameId( vec_iter->getModule() ); // Get ID of given Module Name.
00094 
00095     // check if the given OS has the Module in database, if not add it.
00096     std::string uniqueModuleId_;
00097     uniqueModuleId_ = checkKernelModule( uniqueKernelId_, mod_name_id );
00098 
00099     // Populate pcimap-list in database for the spesific Module of an OS.
00100     if( insertPcimap( &*vec_iter , uniqueModuleId_ ) != 0 ) // C++ Coding Standarts, Rule #78, by Herb Sutter
00101       return 1;
00102 
00103 #ifndef NDEBUG
00104     wApp->log("debug") << "PCIMAP ENTRY PROCESSED!!!";
00105 #endif  // NDEBUG
00106     
00107   }
00108   
00109   return 0;
00110 }
